intro: Galium spurium subsp. vaillantii, commonly known as the narrowleaf bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers, typically in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowering stems are often covered with fine, appressed hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance.
